urls.title: Suspending students for absences, tardies compounds learning loss
urls.description: When suspensions are levied as a punishment for students whose only offense is missing class, problems can snowball.

tweets.text:
Suspending students for missing class—whether it’s because they showed up late, cut midday or were absent entirely—is a controversial tactic. Yet in AZ, the practice is pervasive, a yearlong investigation by @ArizCIR & @hechingerreport has found. 

Part 1: https://t.co/w4aKGQxlNr

Only 1/3 of states ban or limit this disciplinary strategy, leaving schools in much of the country—including AZ—free to punish students for missing class by forcing them to miss even more. Bc of data collection gaps, the scope of the practice has long remained hidden...until now. https://t.co/isgvY83Lsd

urls.title: Big Money for Schools, No Strings Attached: Will MacKenzie Scott Change Education Philanthropy?
urls.description: Billionaire philanthropist MacKenzie Scott gave millions of dollars to dozens of districts and charter schools.

tweets.text: MacKenzie Scott gave districts and charter schools millions of dollars. They didn't apply for the money, they don't know why they were selected, and they can use it however they want. It's a radically different vision for education philanthropy. https://t.co/BZi9mq7AZA

urls.title: ‘Hatred has a great grip on the heart’: election denialism lives on in US battleground
urls.description: Arizona voters rejected key election deniers, but false conspiracy theories have maintained their power

urls.title: Natalie Pate - ewa.org
urls.description: An in-depth look at literacy programs for adults in custody in Oregon prisons, profiling the inmates enrolled and analyzing the impact of these programs in reducing recidivism and creating opportunities upon release. The project will also examine K-12 literacy programs to investigate crime prevention efforts by way of education. Your post will be on the website

tweets.text: Natalie was an outstanding @EdWriters Reporting Fellow. I hope someone smart brings her on board. You can read her project on literacy education and programs for incarcerated adults here: https://t.co/Cp93w9r6LO https://t.co/VLlSFBqffg

Gannett continues its local news carnage. This makes me the only reporter who regularly covers non-sports education news for Oregon's second-largest school district. That's not good for anyone. https://t.co/VD90YqmkIT

With a heavy heart, Dec. 9 will be my last day at @Salem_Statesman. I'm among the many journalists @Gannett laid off this week. 

It's been a great honor covering education for this community for the past 7.5 yrs. Thanks to my team and everyone who trusted me with your stories.
I’ve seen enough Alias to know what’s going on here https://t.co/ceK96AhS9p

urls.title: Once-hopeful Arizona freshmen adapt as the high school experience fades away
urls.description: The transition from grade school sets the course for the rest of high school, experts say. But these students' 9th grade experience is anything but typical.

tweets.text:
I know I will never work on another story like Class Dismissed. I'm so thankful to @lilyalta and @rachelleingang for leading this project and for approaching me at the end of 2019 to help. 

I'll never forget the students or the experience of reporting it. https://t.co/36zsqoVW0e https://t.co/945Hij61r4

The Gannett layoffs got me this time after at least five attempts. 

I'm just going to chill for the rest of the day.

Every time I get a press release from Gov. Whitmer announcing appointments to boards and commissions, I learn about a new public body. This time:
-Michigan Board of Acupuncture
-Michigan Soybean Commission
-Michigan Craft Beverage Council

well well well, @rachelleingang, @lolonghi and I won an @AZPressClub award for our series following third, ninth and tenth graders for a year in 2020. 

Means a lot to share this award with such talented reporters. https://t.co/vppMsHCbYR
Is today a good day to mention I got laid off from USA TODAY/Gannett? https://t.co/sID7F0KsI2
Unfortunately, I am one of the digital producers laid off today by @Gannett. I’ve learned so much from this team, it’s a rough day.
Yemeni coffee is quickly GROWING around here. Qahwah House, Haraz and Qamaria are all places to try. https://t.co/mMRbiUqM8j

BREAKING: I've been laid off. I'm not angry or bitter. After 30 years in the business, I've been lucky to get this far without a layoff. So rather than focus on the horror that is @Gannett, I'm gonna say this: “How lucky I am to have something that makes saying goodbye so hard.”

Sad to say that after 10 years at @USATODAY, I’m among Gannett’s layoffs today. I’m really proud of the sports, Olympics and investigative work I’ve done in that decade. It’s hard to put into words how much I have grown as a reporter from all my experiences here.

urls.title: Community aid donations
urls.description: We're using this form to track potential aid for Gannett employees affected by layoffs. Please fill it out to the best of your ability. Employees will be notified if they're affected on Dec. 1. Once we know what people need, we'll reach out via email and mobilize the folks who are willing to donate. We know people will need help ahead of the holidays, and THANK YOU for being interested in supporting folks during this difficult time. If you have been laid off, please use this form to tell us what you need: https://forms.gle/QwQveVHqsCY5hzJ86

urls.title: Bonded by tragedy, Uvalde, Oxford High School shooting survivors unite in joy

tweets.text:
"After a shooting, childhood feels more fragile for the students who survive. 

Sometimes it feels fleeting."

beautiful, heartbreaking reporting by the amazing @lilyalta https://t.co/GCUj179CYf

urls.title: On a drizzly Saturday, Oxford and Uvalde survivors unite in joy

tweets.text:
This story from @lilyalta is just incredible.  

‘They had a shooter in their school too. They went through what you went through, so they want you to be happy and want you to understand that you’ll be OK.’
https://t.co/J6QUg2RdL1

someone I knew for a year or two after high school was shot and killed this weekend walking his dog. we weren’t close, but I am seeing the kind things his family and friends are seeing on Facebook this morning. 

The unrelenting nature of gun violence is quite jarring https://t.co/mRXbLxyhja
Today’s front page: @sbmaneyphoto and I traveled to Uvalde, Texas. Rather than shared grief, we witnessed shared joy. https://t.co/qsgG4Rbf7j
